TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TabRenderer extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides methods used to render a tab control with visual styles. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TabRenderer class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a tab control with the current visual style of the operating system. Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control. This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should have the appearance of the current visual style. To draw a tab control, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> method to draw the page, and use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> method to draw each tab.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows, the methods of this class will draw the tab control with the current visual style. Otherwise, the methods and properties of this class will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>. To determine whether the members of this class can be used, check the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property.
This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Tab?displayProperty=fullName> class. For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a custom control that uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> methods to draw a basic tab control with two tabs.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.t_32_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.t_32_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.t_32_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DrawTabItem (System.Drawing.Graphics g, System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.TabItemState state);

.method public static hidebysig void DrawTabItem(class System.Drawing.Graphics g, valuetype System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, valuetype System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.TabItemState state) cil managed

Docs.param: The used to draw the tab.
The that specifies the bounds of the tab.
One of the values that specifies the visual state of the tab.
Docs.summary: Draws a tab in the specified state and bounds.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.

Docs.exception:
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsSupported { get; }
.property bool IsSupported

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the class can be used to draw a tab control with visual styles.
Docs.value: if the user has enabled visual styles in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> methods will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
## Examples The following code example uses the IsSupported property to determine whether to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> methods. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer> class.
